basics.name: Glen Barcelo
basics.label: Graduate
basics.summary: A passionate and dedicated computer engineering graduate that fell in love with software engineering. Explored programming in web, mobile, machine learning, and hardware to gain insights about development. Fast learner that enjoys delving into new technologies and being part of a cohesive and motivated team.

work.summary: University of Hawai’i at Mānoa, Department of Information and Computer Sciences
highlights: Designed and developed responsive, interactive web components using TypeScript and HTML/CSS
Analyzed source code and database schemas to migrate legacy features using React, Meteor, and MongoDB
Worked on and managed codebase with Agile development team using Git, GitHub, and ESLint

work.summary: Hack-a-thon: Exploring a JavaScript Web Framework and IoT Applications, 8th Place
highlights: Managed project using Agile development and GitHub Projects to track tasks and distribute work efficiently
Designed and implemented a Wi-Fi-enabled container using a NodeMCU WiFi Development Board, proximity sensor, and load cell sensors
Built appealing, functional website components using React, Meteor, and MongoDB

work.summary: Machine Learning Framework Exploration and Image Processing Applications
highlights: Proposed and implemented object-recognition models that can identify a variety of plant species using Python and TensorFlow’s Object Detection API in Linux
Managed code and environment using Docker, GitHub, and Jupyter

work.summary: Personal Summer Projects: Garage Door Wireless Control
highlights: Designed and implemented a simple wireless controller for a garage door motor using an HC-06 Bluetooth Module, Adafruit Trinket (Arduino), and relay (2017)
Developed an Android app to control the garage door motor via Bluetooth using Arduino technologies, C, and Java (2018)

work.summary: Hack-a-thon: Exploring Java, Android, and Mobile Development, 2nd Place
highlights: Learned Java and Android framework basics to implement competition submission in one week
Managed team learning efforts, workflow, and spirit to meet deadline
